website_summaries.verdict: GoPro's choice microSD card, the Lexar 633x, is tuned for high-intensity video recording.
cons: Not as fast at transferring files as other cards

customer_reviews.title: Lexar Product = 0 stars; Amazon Service = 10 stars
customer_reviews.text: I own around a dozen MicroSD cards, mostly SanDisk (including 128GB cards), but also Samsung and others, and I've never had a single problem. This was my first Lexar purchase and will be my last. The card stopped working after one use, reported itself as constantly write-protected, and all efforts using disk check/repair tools, formatting tools, etc., failed. I recommend reading the comprehensive review posted by U. Bank, as I believe my problem was the same - these cards are clearly not going through an effective quality control check. Thankfully, Amazon took care of me with their usual excellent service.
customer_reviews.author: rpr

customer_reviews.title: STOPS WORKING AFTER 1 YEAR
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this SD card at first. It worked great. BUT - after a year of using and with zero damage or excessive use to the card, it no longer works. I took it for Christmas vacation to take videos of my trip and my family, but the card crapped out and showed NOTHING on the card - not 0/2XXX or whatever - it was 0/0000 and said the card couldn't be read. Again - I didn't use the card excessively or put it through extreme conditions. It simply stopped working. I will not be buying another one of these again. Spend your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A trustworthy card!
customer_reviews.text: This card is the perfect size to hold pictures and videos on my GoPro. I have taken it out west several times on trips to the Grand Canyon and Utah. The card holds everything that I need it to! I have never had the card malfunction. I have had many cards in the past have errors and my images and videos have been erased. With this card, I have no worries of that happening. I know I will be enjoying this card for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: HaileyJ

customer_reviews.title: Initially buggy, failed completely after 2yr
customer_reviews.text: I know these things have finite life. But i have had it in my gopro and my phone the last 2 years and it would lose and corrupt photos and videos from the very start. Now it has reached end of life and failed to a read only state. This is a bit premature. I do not use the gopro nor the phone the amount i would have to complete the lifetime of write operations. This is just garbage. Buy the samsung. I have a card from samsung that is 7yrs old now.
customer_reviews.author: Dave H

customer_reviews.title: Great for family videos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Go Pro Hero, link below, and it works perfectly. I have gotten great video with this and have not regretted buying it. I do not shoot professional video with this but just capture video of my family and friends when we go on trips and have had more than enough room. Would get another if I go on extended trips. Go Pro Hero I am part of the Amazon Associates Program
customer_reviews.author: Nick Rinz

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: At first I gave this 4 stars and wrote: Hi quality and nice usb connector. No electronic video glitches. Highly recommended. Now that I have been using it for 3 1/2 months, I am suddenly seeing quite bad video noise when recording stop action with a GoPro Hero4 camera. This is quite upsetting as reviews for this card were great which pushed me to select it. Sorry, but I must downgrade my review to a 1 star as the footage of a VERY important and unrepeatable event was ruined. It may be a bum card and I would be open to a replacement to test it, but Amazon says it is too late to make an exchange. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Fast Speeds - Very Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this card on my GoPro, and it performs great! I haven't had any trouble recording 4k videos and taking multiple burst photos without having any lag waiting for the card to catch up. The read and write speeds are fantastic and I haven't had a single problem with the card. No hiccups, no pauses, and no troubles. The card performs exactly as you'd expect, probably even a little better. The usb micro reader that comes with the card is a great bonus! My computer doesn't have anything to read it by default, but the included reader makes it simple and fast to transfer my photos and videos to my computer.
customer_reviews.author: RobbyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good card, but not as fast as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card primarily to use in my GoPro Hero4 Silver. When I got it, I ran some speed tests from my Surface Pro 3, and while it is a fast card, it's not as fast as advertised. Here are the speeds I'm getting: Using the included USB3.0 adapter in the USB port on the Surface Pro 3 (also USB 3.0): Writing speed: 40.7 MByte/s Reading speed: 71.4 MByte/s Using the built-in microSD card slot: Writing speed: 40.1 MByte/s Reading speed: 68.2 MByte/s
customer_reviews.author: Cook

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine but limited life
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well for 2 years then it failed. It was not as fast as the the LG internal memory. Most of the data was still readable after it failed, so I could copy most of it out to a computer. Now I just pay for inexpensive 100GB cloud storage, instead of using an SD card. It was a long process to discover that the sd card was failing, because the phone was just running slower and slower over 2-3 months, and acting up in general. I kept getting various permissions problems and had to keep rebooting.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Wally

customer_reviews.title: Dud.
customer_reviews.text: My Surface 3 would not recognize; after reading solutions online, reformatted as NTFS (in separate PC) and that worked somewhat. Used it for a week with somewhat unstable performance, and then it died completely-won't work at all in any machine. I have another XC card (smaller capacity, lower data rate) from another brand, that I popped in the tablet and it works fine. complete garbage.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chi

customer_reviews.title: My Use / Review
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for use in my DJI Phantom 3 Professional. I shoot in 4k as well as 1080, and you might know that takes quite a bit of storage at times. I edit my videos on a Mac using Final Cut Pro X and couldn't be happier with the performance. Formated these in exFAT format and they now work on Mac, Surface, TV, Desktop all using the free USB dongle they have provided with the card. Excellent price for the performance in my opinion. Card: Drone:
customer_reviews.author: Lostsoulbrand

customer_reviews.title: NOT suitable for GoPro Hero 4K or most 4K videos. See pics.
customer_reviews.text: This card is ok for most cellphones and point and shoot cameras. This isnt suitable for 4K video. GoPro Hero 4 Black requires write speeds of 40MB/sec. This card only goes up to 20MB/sec. Which kept shutting down recordings. Beware of misleading description and labeling. You are buying an old & slower SD card for the price of a new & faster Micro SD card. Model# on the description and the label attached to the back of the package says LSDMI64GBBNL633R [Conveniently its the same model# recommended by GoPros Website]. Look at the photos. If you carefully peel that label you'll see the manufacturers label underneath which has the correct model # [ LSDMI64GBB1NL633R].
customer_reviews.author: RK Medic

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat disappointed with write speed using the supplied USB 3
customer_reviews.text: Item shipped quickly and works. Getting 119 GB formatted capacity (ex-FAT). Somewhat disappointed with write speed using the supplied USB 3.O reader. The listing claimed the U1 and U3 chips were identical (i.e. "Performance of U1 and U3 version is exactly the same.") but I was inadvertently sent a 32GB U3 chip by mistake and it tested much faster than this 128GB U1 chip I ordered so performance is definitely NOT the Same. Was getting above 30MB/s write speed with the 32GB U3 chip but only around 19MB/s with the 128GB U1 chip. In comparison I also have a Sandisk 32GB Extreme U3 chip and it was writing around 45MB/s rate. Read speed on all three chips was over 85MB/s.
customer_reviews.author: Saltlifer

customer_reviews.title: The most reliable and fastest Micro SD card I've found for my Blackvue Dashcam.
customer_reviews.text: The Blackvue Dashcam (dr650gw-2ch) can be picky when it comes to Micro SC cards and compatibility (SanDisk cards won't work at all), especially since it only officially supports cards up to 64 GB. This card is a real champ. It works reliably and flawlessly in my dashcam, and gives me 2-3 weeks of recordings, depending on how much I drive. It ready very quickly on the computer and delivers superior performance. With this card, I was able to catch the auto transporter taking my car for a joy ride!
customer_reviews.author: JBoi

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in 2015. It still works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back then when it was a little bit more expensive but was the recommended memory for a HERO Silver4. It still works as well as day one and the read/write speeds are fast enough to transfer the videos quickly from the card to your PC.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chua

customer_reviews.title: CAN'T MISS WITH a LEXAR
customer_reviews.text: LEXAR has allways been the best for me,with it's read and write USB adpter it's great. ( F.Y.I. don't try to use a 32 GB reader and writer with a [64 GB MICRO CHIP] ) The product has been so "GREAT" I've given more of them away as gifts than I have myself. Make sure the one you select doesn't write faster that your Digital device can handle exaple a cell phone ! / Don't worry about your computer,it can handle the speed. " This dosen't mean you can't get your data from a device and put the micro chip in your cell phone. "
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: Production Variability?
customer_reviews.text: I think Lexar cards are generally great. In fact, I have two Lexar 128GB SDXC UHS-II U3 cards that read very close to their advertised 150MB/sec speed. Unfortunately, my particular instance of this card reads at only 70MB/sec on the same equipment. That's more than 25% shy of its advertised 95MB/sec speed. That's unacceptable. Having only one of these, I can't say whether this is an anomaly or a model wide issue. Regardless, I'll be returning this particular card.
customer_reviews.author: Maelstrom

customer_reviews.title: UPGRADE
customer_reviews.text: Very good and i got the u1 not the u3 as the description, either way it works like magic and 4k recording is no problem either. It was exactly what i was looking for and definitely recommend. Its amazingly fast and the usb reader is very handy. The packaging was different then what ive seen people put here so im guessing there might be some different versions/types or even replicas of this card going around...so just watch out for that
customer_reviews.author: Secretsecret

customer_reviews.title: Great performance, great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father for Christmas. I have personally never owned any Lexar memory cards, but this one has been doing a great job so far. No issues with recording HD video or playback. Plus, every microSD I've ever owned comes with a regular SD card sized adapter for transferring files to your PC. This one came with a cool USB adapter which isn't necessarily any better or worse depending on your needs, but we were able to record video instantly and plug it in via the USB adapter to watch it on our HDTV.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: TRASH! SAVE YOUR MONEY!!
customer_reviews.text: Failed a few days before the one year mark. Complete trash! Save your money! Card was in my cellphone for almost a year until one day the card was not able to read. I tried numerous programs to access the card but no luck. Hundreds of family pictures and video are lost. And no use in salvaging the memory card by formatting it because some how it write protected itself before going dead. Waste of money and loss of precious family moments.
customer_reviews.author: big250d

customer_reviews.title: Not fast enough write speed for Hero4 + external mic
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it's not fast enough for HD video. I bought this when I bought a GoPro Hero4 as it was a card GoPro recommended on their site as having been tested and certified to work. Write speed is not high enough to deal with the 1080p 60fps video AND an external audio channel. I encountered errors while using this with the USB mic adapter and an external microphone. I've since replaced it with a faster card and my audio problems have disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: Scooby921Top Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: I love these cards, some come with a nice adaptor.
customer_reviews.text: I would rather put music and videos on this card than a DVD-r or BD-r even an overpriced M-disc. The speed I can watch a video and choose a different one is was faster than waiting, and waiting for a disc to boot up is terrible. I may have to go with out discs for a while. I own a dvd and a blu ray player but have no use for them. My vehicle is all usb or Bluetooth and the android box at home reads cards and usb. So I guess discs are a 90-00's era becoming old school.
customer_reviews.author: Uni-ball

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this and went back and forth which brand ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my Microsoft Surface Pro 3. Plug and Play - I put the card in (fits perfectly, apparently the SanDisk may or may not fit perfectly) and it worked right away, I didn't have to do anything. 119 GB show up as usable out of 128 gb. I don't have any data, but it is fast, but don't expect it to be as fast as the internal hard drive. I am very happy with this and went back and forth which brand to buy. Now I can store more files on my Surface Pro 3 without carrying around an extra portable hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Essentially useless after less than one year of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card a little over a year ago. About 2-3 months ago the card became "read only" and there is no way to make it writeable again. I've tried formatting it from a number of different machines with no success. The card is now basically worthless and there's not much I can do about it. I realize that there is a shelf life on electronics, but this card didn't even make it a year. Would love help here if anyone has any tips.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin D. Amundgaard

customer_reviews.title: If you are on the fence about buying it, get it.
customer_reviews.text: Semi pricey, but this vs the 16gb one I had in my phone previously is like upgrading a computer from 2008. It's fast enough to write 4k video from my Note 4, and has a ton of room. It's worth the buy. PLUS you get the 3.0 USB dongle with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nuroppo

customer_reviews.title: Bought from Amazon was defective!
customer_reviews.text: Worked 3 times and then stopped working. Someone told me Lexar is a bad brand, I now understand why seeing as I always have bought Sandisk. It always said SD card error in every device (gopro, android, mac) I put it in. It also would not let me delete any files off of it. Something was really wrong with it. Yes, it was the offical product cause others have said they got counterfeits. Bought it from Amazon and it was offical, just a dud. Be careful when buying this l, yea it's cheap but I'd rather have something last for the long run not just a couple of days.
customer_reviews.author: jrs527

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly with the GoPro Hero3+
customer_reviews.text: Works Perfectly with the GoPro Hero3+. I like that I pretty can forget about this card inside my GoPro. It allows 4.5 hours of recording and I have had zero issues with it to date. This after extensive daily use for a few weeks. The only think I don't like is the price. Sucks that the GoPro requires such a high end device, but you need it. The 16GB class 6 I tried when I first got the camera because it was all I had, forced the camera to stop recording randomly and skipped. If you have a GoPro, you need it. Buy it. Best price you're going to find.
customer_reviews.author: sk123

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working well, became un-erasable
customer_reviews.text: Phone started to behave weird... replaced the card with another one we had and problem solved. Months later I try to use this micro sd card and trying to erase the data I get "write protected" and I cannot do anything... after an hour or so of searching the internet, the solution is to backup and trash it... what a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: RaSo

customer_reviews.title: Super FAST microSD (633x), Great Price, and Fast USB 3 adapter! FIVE STAR Product!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Product! GREAT Price! I purchased several of these and am very impressed with the speed. I use the 32GB microSD card in my Samsung Galaxy S5 phone and in my Samsung Galaxy S 10.5 Android tablet. Because of the speed rating of this chip (Class-10 633x), I don't have any delays, video frame loss like whe I use cheaper and lower rated chips. It's also a great idea for the USB 3 microSD converter! You can't beat it. If you need a reliable and FAST microSD card with a USB 3 converter, this is by far your best choice! This is a FIVE STAR Product, I highly recommend this device and the seller!
customer_reviews.author: LOGOSYS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome flash memory for an awesome price
customer_reviews.text: All I have to really say about this is that it is some of the fastest flash media I have ever used. I can personally attest that with my ZenFone 2 recording and snapping photos in HD and UHD has been a breeze. I had a PNY class 10 chip that would cause a slight hang and freeze whenever the card was accessed. With this one these issues are non existent. It's a must have for anyone who needs that extra space and wants to be able to take non-stop UHD photos without missing a shot ;) I plan on picking some more of these up on an as needed basis ;)
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Strife

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly in Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: After three different attempts with other brands in my Surface Pro 3 but continuing to face random dismounts and boot and slowness issues, I purchased this chip after reading some forums indicating the brand of the mSD card mattered. This has worked fast and flawlessly. It came with a USB3 adapter which also works well, but after transferring a VMWare machine from it, it actually overheated and dismounted itself. No damage to the card or the data from what I can tell, but do take note for very large transfers. That only happened once and through the adapter--never noticed any issues when used in the SP3 slot.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Worked...but not last long...Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Order this card (128G) in Jan on amazon for my mobile phone, but only worked until last week and refused to record anything on the card without any reason. When the card is working, it is super fast and smooth on my mobile phone, but only last more than half year, otherwise I will give five star for sure! Very disappointed with the card quality now and have to consider replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Pan Dongsheng

customer_reviews.title: Surface Pro 3 media storage
customer_reviews.text: Didn't expect the advertised speeds but only was getting about 20 MB/s in write speed which was kind of dissapointing but not too terrible for such a large card. Didn't test read speeds but I'm using it to add 128 GB of storage to my surface pro 3 and songs and videos load instantly and fast forwarding is smooth and not jumpy at all. The USB adapter is nice and works well with random other Samsung and scandisc cards I had lying around. Overall I'm satisfied with the purchase, just not blown away like I was hoping to be
customer_reviews.author: lhall

customer_reviews.title: Device was too hot to touch upon shutdown and had to cool down before the computer would see it again
customer_reviews.text: Thermal Issues Exist I received my Lexar sdxc128 * 633 from Amazon yesterday and loaded DivX files at about 21 MG ps and mp3's at between 11 MBps and 16 MBps using the enclosed USB 3 adapter. I was able to load between 3GB and 20GB at a time before the device experienced thermal shutdown. Device was too hot to touch upon shutdown and had to cool down before the computer would see it again. Do I have a problem unit or is this the unavoidable nature of the beast? I intend to run it in my LG G3 so I would be tasking it more gently than with my uploading. Should I return it - exchange it?
customer_reviews.author: Lemlux

customer_reviews.title: Freezes up Gopro
customer_reviews.text: Freezes up GoPro Hero 4 Black, in very specific modes, such as when doing 2.7k Super view. That mode works fine with regular Samsung EVO 10 cards (not even high speed PRO) but freezes up when this card is used. It works fine in 1080P and 2.7K regular, and 4K sometimes. But it is not reliable and I would not trust for important filming settings, such as you might miss a sunset because it froze up, or any other moments that won't give you second chances to restart camera.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but totally worth it
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a Samsung Note 4 and was looking for an extended memory card to store all the music. I bought Sandisk since it was cheaper than Samsung and Lexar micro SD cards and it turned out to be a bummer because my phablet wouldn't recognize Sandisk. When I looked up online, a lot of people suggested that Lexar is the alternative to Samsung in terms of device compatibility, and so I decided to give this a try. Lexar just synced seamlessly with my mobile and so far hasn't caused any issues. Keeping my fingers crossed! It is pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few month. Now it just collects dust.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a few months. Does not work anymore. I'm a Linux Systems Enginneer so I would hope it's not user error. I've tried reading and/or formatting on a MacBook, Lenovo T450 with Windows 7 and a desktop with Fedora 22. None of them recognize the card. I've tried usb micro readers and SD micro adapter cards. This thing doesn't work in any scenario. I got a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly C.

customer_reviews.title: WORKS WITH HERO 4 black  4K super wide 30fps mode!  A couple bucks more - BUT WORTH IT.
customer_reviews.text: YES! After trying another card (lower in price) and finding it would not work with GoPro in high res modes. I ordered this card. IT comes with a nice USB reader (3.0) which is better than the plastic micro SD to SD convertor. And this CARD WORKS. I have done some initial testing in goPro hero4 4K mode. (30fps) and 4K super wide in max 24fps. Worked GREAT- Even the life video feed to my phone was supported and I could watch the phone as a viewfinder with the GoPro app while shooting in this super high res mode.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Received the product on time and have so far been happy with it. I mainly ordered it to have so that I could increase the space on my tablet. Plenty of room for pictures, music, videos or whatever I need. It also came with an extremely convenient usb that allows you to easily transfer everything on sd card onto a computer or other device. Can't really say that the read/write speeds are noticeably faster than any other company but I also don't really transfer files that are enormous.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: It seems they switched out the photo on the listing ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems they switched out the photo on the listing as originally it showed U3. I received a U1 and although the listing said they were the same performance, after several benchmarks, it was clear this card wasn't as fast. I ended up getting a Samsung Pro+ 128gb card and it's MUCH faster.
customer_reviews.author: B. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Best memory card for cameras or GoPros, period.
customer_reviews.text: If you have a GoPro there is no better card that you should buy, you never have to worry about space or quality with this. I took my GoPro to Europe for two weeks and I had over 8 hours of space to record. It was just amazing to not worry about space! I highly recommend getting this! I am going to order another one for my point and shoot camera now because it was just amazing to not have to worry about anything! I highly recommend buying for anyone who travels (outdoor or recreation).
customer_reviews.author: John Whitehill Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Note 4
customer_reviews.text: This card is faster than the 64GB Samsung SD card I had in my Note 4. I upgraded to the 128 GB... this card does not disappoint. worked right out the box without having to format. I transferred about 56GB of data from a older card to this 128 in less than 1 hour. I bet it would transfer faster if I did if the data was form my SSD rather than an older 64GB Micro SD card.
customer_reviews.author: I bought this

customer_reviews.title: Write locked after several months.
customer_reviews.text: Well, like many others on here I believe my expensive fancy high speed flash card has write locked itself outside of the Amazon return window. Nothing I can do about it. I owned this for just over 6 months with occasional problems, but finally it just died outright causing no end of havoc with every application that relied upon it. I will try Lexar's RMA process, but I don't have much hope if other reviewers are to be believed.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Kirsch

customer_reviews.title: I recieved a FAKE
customer_reviews.text: This card started failing after about 3 years of use. I used SD insight to check the card and the manufacturer came back as "Balun Electronics", thus I can only conclude that I received a fake SD card. Buyer beware! Make sure you verify the card is legitimate before the return period ends.
customer_reviews.author: R. Byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Fast... and certainly the price was right
customer_reviews.text: Very nice card for a smidge over $30. Read speeds are far faster than write, over twice as fast (~90 vs. ~40)... but for the money, very satisfied. Used as tiny external storage for graphics files, doesn't disappoint. Would have to pay quite a bit more to have write speeds at >95MB/sec, and this works just fine for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: kinakomochi

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: This is my first real high speed micro sd card. I ended up picking this up a week or so after I picked up a new GoPro as this was one of two recommended micro sd cards. I own a few other micro sd cards that are a few years old and they topped out at 30 MB/s (using the Lexar reader connected to USB 3.0). Using the Lexar reader connected to a USB 3.0 port I was able to copy video off of the card at 95-97 MB/s and onto my SSD on my PC. As long as the card holds up as long as my others have, I will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent
customer_reviews.text: This Lexar MicroSDXC storage is fast and works great. Every camera I own have been able to save to this card. I have had no trouble with it. It is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: David Tran

customer_reviews.title: Great card and speedy as promised (trash the free reader though)
customer_reviews.text: Quite fast, good price for the size. The included reader is NOT RELIABLE. The USB3 reader sometimes works and sometimes doesn't or might work slow. When it doesn't work it will get very hot if you leave it plugged in, which has been reported to melt the plastic case (Google the reader's model number). Basically just but this for the great card at a good price and immediately throw away the bonus reader.
customer_reviews.author: Ben R

customer_reviews.title: Won't work with XP.  Works perfectly on Win7 and Higher.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Just a heads up for other computer dinosaurs like me... This is a USB 3 device. Windows XP will not support it. It won't read or format it. Save yourself the time and aggrivation and listen to me. I upgraded XP to WIN7 and it works like a charm. I was going to give it 4 stars because of that, but I changed it to 5 since the product works perfectly and it's an XP conflict with USB3 that was the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Threedog

customer_reviews.title: Micro Champion
customer_reviews.text: Lexar is the best of the best. i only use Lexar in my Galaxy Note 4 smart phone. Went from 64Gb to 256Gb and all of them work insanely accurate. I would not trust any others, including Samsung!! Their speed, performance and longevity are uncanny. Try them and you will feel the same.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher George

customer_reviews.title: I went through 3 of these before realizing they are ...
customer_reviews.text: I went through 3 of these before realizing they are incompatible with GoPro cameras. Random errors and record stops after several seconds. DO NOT USE in GoPros even though they say approved. Stick with SandDisk extreme Pro for 100% guaranteed performance.
customer_reviews.author: CigarObsession

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Lexar
customer_reviews.text: Basically junk. Lost all pictures and videos. Files corrupt. It could cost me $200 to attempt to recover the files and there is no guarantee. Lost my Tom Petty videos along with the Foo Fighters. I'm devastated.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas D Bray

customer_reviews.title: Initially used it for my gopro4 black after seeing a ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially used it for my gopro4 black after seeing a bunch of recommendations but saw some jitter in my 4k videos and then read up about microSD speeds and how companies have mislabeled their cards. What a nightmare, but I put this in my Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge and everything works perfectly so it wasn't a completely loss.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS. This is cheap and will delete your pictures and videos. Even if you reformat this it will still lose everything to put onto it. This item should be removed from the site and never sold again. Very unhappy with this product and won't ever buy anything again with this brand name. This was for my honeymoon, thanks goodness I've tried to use this before it. How would my honeymoon memories be replaced when this product doesn't work?
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: I am using this with my Samsung Note 4 and just want to tell you how awesome it is to no longer suffer from storage anxiety
customer_reviews.text: I wont post my speeds as they were consistent with other reviewers speed tests. I am using this with my Samsung Note 4 and just want to tell you how awesome it is to no longer suffer from storage anxiety. This card gave me a reason to test the phone's 4k recording and it worked great. The Micro SD to USB adapter that comes with it is really small and very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Sleepless in Buffalo

customer_reviews.title: 2nd one not DOA
customer_reviews.text: 128GB version - 3-stars for the simple fact my first one came to me DOA. That's unacceptable, but Amazon made good on it. Just received the replacement and read times are crazy nice; however write times are not what I expected. Its still the fastest MicroSDXC in my stable. Good purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: M. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for my Lumia 640. It worked up until ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Lumia 640. It worked up until last week. I put some new songs on the card but the files will not stay on it. I tried to format the card but I keep getting the error message: 'Windows was unable to complete the format". I'm at a loss as to what to do. I've tried 4 different card readers to format the card but to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a miniature USB 3.0 microSD adapter.
customer_reviews.text: This comes with a miniature USB 3.0 microSD adapter. This is an excellent deal. Transfer seems much faster than other microSD (Samsung, Sandisk) cards I have around; no scientific number though. I was disappointed with SanDisk microSD adapter that kills my 32GB Sandisk microSD card; it was too hot to touch. So far, I don't have issue with this Lexar microSD card and adapter combo.
customer_reviews.author: AlphaTrio

customer_reviews.title: Good while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: Died after a little over a year. Suddenly starting saying it was 'corrupt' and wanted to reformat it on both Android and windows PC - will no longer work :( It was good up until then but I have older cheaper SD cards which still work fine. Disappointed. UPDATE: I checked the warrant on their website and it turns out this card has a lifetime warranty! I was able to create an RMA and Lexar promptly replaced the card no questions asked!
customer_reviews.author: TJG

customer_reviews.title: it's not that fast like other people saying
customer_reviews.text: it's not that fast like other people saying, I only get around 30m w and 80m r. moreover, I was using it for my surface 3, and it automatically ejected multiple times after about 30 mins every time. I purchased another Sandisk extreme one, the automatically eject problem never happens.
customer_reviews.author: littleSwift

customer_reviews.title: The USB adaptor could use some improvement but otherwise works well
customer_reviews.text: Got this card with my GoPro Hero4 Silver order. The card works with the camera without problem. The only problem I've had with it is with the USB reader that comes with it. The card slides so far into the reader that it can be difficult to remove without the use of tweezers, the wife's fingernails, or the small fingers of a child. Using the included USB adapter as reported by Windows 8.1 (i5-4430 @ 3GHz w/ 8GB RAM), these are the read/write speeds I'm seeing on this card. Read speeds peak about 86-88 MB/s. Write speeds peak about 42-44 MB/s.
customer_reviews.author: Nick K

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast Transfer
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit disappointed that Amazon changed this item after I bought it. Originally, there was only one Lexar 633x 64gb microsd on Amazon, but after I ordered this one, they added a "new version" of this microsd card and labelled this as "the older version." Nonetheless, it is very fast and suits all my needs. Great Quality.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Mooney

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Did really well for the first several months, but then in the provided card reader it gets so hot or melted.. Lost 26gb of photos and videos I'll never get back. Great speed, and performance, but there is no longevity to the card. Consumer beware you'll lose priceless photos in a blink of an eye.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin P.

customer_reviews.title: Really good card for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good card for the price I use it in my phantom drone I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: gee

customer_reviews.title: I bought this micro SD card during a Black Friday ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this micro SD card during a Black Friday sale. At first, the micro SD card worked as expected. 6 Months into using it, the SD card got corrupted. I had to factory reset my phone to get it to work properly again. As for the micro SD card, I'm still trying to recover the data. Pro Tip: Before using the SD card make sure it's not a fake and does what the description says it will.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Glitzos

customer_reviews.title: Either Defective or Fake... Won't go any Faster than 5.9 MB/second
customer_reviews.text: Will only transfer data at 5.9 MB/sec. The high speed USB 2.0 reader that it came with is NOT the problem, as when I put my Samsung Pro 64 GB micro SD card in it I get bursts of 95 MB/second and sustained read speeds of 70 MB/second. But with the Lexar 633x card it never gets over 6 MB/second. I don't know if I got a defective card, or if it is fake, but it is definitely NOT high speed. Will be asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Franklin's Cat

customer_reviews.title: Convienent USB adapter, incredible speed from card.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Samsung Galaxy S5. I love being able to customize the amount of storage my phone has, without upgrading it. The card came with a nifty USB adapter, which is better IMHO than a SD card adapter. My phone is accessing content on the MicroSD card much faster than my previous card. I will definitely buy the 128GB of this type and brand at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in Samsung Note 4, but got really slow with age.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this in my Note 4 since the start of June 2015 (Feb. 24th, 2016 today) and it's given me zero problems. Speed feels good too. Edit: Almost a year later, this card did not stand up to regular use. It's now super slow, maybe hitting 5MB/s READ when trying to copy files from it on to a computer using a USB 3.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: for my samsung galaxy S5 THe best part is it still worked even when i got ...
customer_reviews.text: works well.for my samsung galaxy S5 THe best part is it still worked even when i got it wet. MY whole phone got water damaged in salt water, the insides got wet, the sim card, battery, this microSD card. I thought I lost everthing in my MicroSD. I was SOOO relieved when I was still able to pull up my data/photos using the new phone. Thank you Lexar, Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Consumer

customer_reviews.title: My first two worked great but this last one
customer_reviews.text: Broken, Smashed, melted packaging, with water damage, and the card looks like it is fake (thickness of the Lexar 633x & class 10 symbols and letters are thinner writing) these cards are great and even work with older phones that only take SDHC (32GB Max Cards) Inspected by Amazon!?!
customer_reviews.author: ALW

customer_reviews.title: Works great, USB reader was much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I tried this out steaming 4K drone video into a USB 3.0 port. No issues. The included USB reader was great. I received two other USB/microSD readers with other purchases. In both cases the USB was always required a little too much force to plug in. The Lexar version fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: False Advertisement to say the least. Buyer Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: This item pictured was NOT what was received in my packaged from Amazon... Some of the reviews stated the 64GB were in fact the UHS-I 3 but I received a UHS-I 1... This is about half the write speed and did not perform optimal for 50M saves for HD video on some high-end action cameras. Crappy because I could have purchased the SAME card that is actually advertised properly for about 10$ less..... This is just BS.. Wish I would have known before-hand so wouldn't have wasted my money.
customer_reviews.author: Weldon Kimble

customer_reviews.title: Good price (as I write this).
customer_reviews.text: It really isn't better or worse than any other micro SDHC card with the same specs. What was nice as I write this is that it was cheaper than others I found. What is nice is that these come a USB adapter instead of a standard SD adapter. But, that is probably because you need it to take advantage of the USB 3.0 faster standard. We did get it for a GoPro.
customer_reviews.author: kireviewer

customer_reviews.title: Add space!
customer_reviews.text: I have this card in my galaxy note 4 and it works flawlessly it provides me with plenty of extra space when I want to add movies to my phone. I use this card as my default download space but only using the native browser on my phone if I'm downloading directly into my phone and not using my computer. It was pretty cheap when I bought it and I know the price has dropped even more since then
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Good quality SD card. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: This MicroSD card works great. I have been using it in my action cam, and have had no issues so far. 32GB isn't a ton of storage, but that was the max amount that was compatible with my camera. It works perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: High Performance Micro SD Card
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to work with my Asus ZenFone 2, and it works very well with the ZenFone 2. I bought the San Disk Ultra 64gb before, but it does not comparable with the ZenFone 2. After I researched on internet, people said that only the LExar 633x 128GB can comparable with Asus ZenFone 2. Also, for 128GB, it can save a lot of pictures and movies. I recommended it if you own a Asus ZenFone.
customer_reviews.author: A C

customer_reviews.title: Works, kinda, although it does whats expected
customer_reviews.text: Used for my action camera. Works fine, had to mess with camera settings though. I got the real thing, so i'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jade M.

customer_reviews.title: A good deal
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this "used" SD card because normally not too much can go wrong with these memory cards. However, the first one I received appeared to be missing the protected area on the card. It was very easy to return and reorder another used card. The second card came but my system kept reporting that it was unformatted. I've never gotten a card that was unformatted before. I found a format program for both Windows and the Mac at www.sdcard.org/downloads/formatter_4/eula_windows/index.html, this program formatted the card and made it usable. The only gripe I have is that the card unformatted and no documentation on how to resolve this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Byer

customer_reviews.title: works, but does not work with Sandisk microSD
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mainly for my GoPro Hero3+ and because I have other micro SD cards. This is a great on-the-go product, especially if not all computers have a built in SD slot. This product works perfectly and it's fast. But I did read up on some reviewers that it worked with their Sandisk microSD. I tried a couple of my Sandisks, but it didn't read :/ and yes, they're all class 10
customer_reviews.author: c.mac

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for about 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and used in a Galaxy S7 Edge. Worked great for about 6 months. Just stopped being read by the phone. PC will read it but cannot write to card. Says it is write protected. Apparently when these cards fail, they fail-safe to read only mode. I was able to get all my pictures and video off the card which is good but the card is unusable now. They have a lifetime warranty so hopefully Lexar takes care of things for me. I will edit my review once I go through the warranty process.

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a few months.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 6 months. The first week I wrote 100GB of data to it. I've written less than 2GB of data since, and have deleted under 1GB of data. It just write protected itself permanently. My phone no longer recognizes it and my computer can't fix the errors or reformat because the disk is write-protected. I've tried CHKDSK, DISKPART, and going through the GUIS on three different computers on two operating systems. She's dead, Jim. I expected more than 6 months of use out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Bekeleven

customer_reviews.title: Never recommend this product to anyone and please dont buy this ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this lexar card on my Galaxy S7 edge and yesterday all of a sudden the card is corrupted. Today I realized the card is totally dead. Never recommend this product to anyone and please dont buy this item, unless you are ready to lose it in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Shreedhar

customer_reviews.title: they said that the Sandisk Ultra had been removed from their approved cards and recommended the Lexar
customer_reviews.text: I had previously purchased a Sandisk Ultra for my GoPro Hero3+ Black Edition camera and although it was a Class 10, the camera would often stop recording. After contacting GoPro, they said that the Sandisk Ultra had been removed from their approved cards and recommended the Lexar. After switching to the Lexar, the camera has not stopped recording once! This card is incredibly fast and works perfectly with the GoPro Hero3+ Black.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stevens

customer_reviews.title: This is a Good One!!
customer_reviews.text: Boy, oh, Boy! Finally! I don't miss Anything with this massive, high-speed, memory! I wish ALL my compact electronic devices could use this colossal memory size for storage! It holds all kinds of information - and recalls it lightening fast! I would indeed recommend it to anyone who has devices which can/will receive its' capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Chainsaw

customer_reviews.title: Time to see how good Lexar is on their RMA system
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 3 months then went into "write protect mode" not allowing me to format or access the card from my phone. Ended up putting it into my computer to at least copy the data off of it, but still can't format it or use it any longer. Time to see how good Lexar is on their RMA system.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fields

customer_reviews.title: Seems like companies are purposely making things to not last long
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 20 months then stopped working. My computer can't even recognize it. During the 20 months it stopped working 3 times and had to be reformatted. Seems like companies are purposely making things to not last long.
customer_reviews.author: stef

customer_reviews.title: Fast enough for extra storage on Surface Pro 3
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use as a "2nd HDD" for my Surface Pro 3. Using the USB 3.0 adapter it came with, I am getting about 85MB/sec Read and about 20MB/Sec Write. However on the Surface Pro 3's MicroSD USB 3.0 Slot it was much slower. around 72MB/Sec Read and about 13.5MB/Write. You will ONLY get those type of speed on the SP3 is if enable Write Cache in Windows. OR else it will be DEAD slow on the Write... from .7KB/sec to 1MB/Sec write
customer_reviews.author: Johnny W.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Choice for GoPro Hero Black
customer_reviews.text: I have had this card for about 6 months and use it exclusively with my GoPro Hero 3 Black. I have never had any issue with the card, it's fast and holds a ton. It's capable of writing speeds and quality exceeding what most of our playback systems can even display, so this won't become obsolete anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: GC

customer_reviews.title: Go Pro Hero 4 Silver Works
customer_reviews.text: So far I am impressed with this SD card. Its sad that I have to put a rewarding review for a SD card that actually does what it says it will do. This works in my hero 4 silver. To everyone else don't go off of what stores will tell you "should" and "shouldn't" work for a Go Pro. Go off of Go Pro's website and get the SD card off of that. This was one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: 128gb is awful and not 3.0!
customer_reviews.text: Already broken. Tried using it for my retropie setup on raspberry pie and it doesn't work. Have been using it on my cell phone and it's been corrupted three times for no aparent reason. Also the ad says it's a 3.0 speed but it's not, it 1.0. Using tricky titles it changed when you select 128gb even though in the seaech field it say 3.0
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I have recorded hours and hours of footage on several ...
customer_reviews.text: I have recorded hours and hours of footage on several devices with this , mainly Go Pro White 3 and its still going strong. The adapter it came with has been incredible helpful.
customer_reviews.author: David Briceno Ulate

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast on my computer with the supplied USB 3.0 Reader
customer_reviews.text: The Lexar memory card has worked amazingly in my GoPro hero 4 Black edition. I've been able to get phenomenally fast performance with it using the included USB 3.0 reader on my MacBook Pro. I highly recommend it for use with the new GoPro.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Korhonen

customer_reviews.title: Great for GoPro 4
customer_reviews.text: one of the few recommended card for GoPro Hero 4 Sessionby the gopro site. i.e. the card can really sustain heavy sequential write speed.
customer_reviews.author: T.Perraut

customer_reviews.title: This SD card is great. I got it with my Go Pro
customer_reviews.text: This SD card is great. I got it with my Go Pro, and now use it exclusively. It's a fast card, optimized for HD video. Lexar makes a good card at a good price and I have started using them in all my cameras and my drone. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Schuler

customer_reviews.title: Great memory for my newest telephone.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this inside my Samsung S5 Galaxy phone for additional storage. It works exactly as I expected it to. Be sure to check the specifications for your phone or other digital device. Some have lower limits, such as 32GB or even 16GB or less, so be sure to get what will fit in your phone.
customer_reviews.author: JohnAroundTheCornerReviews

customer_reviews.title: Get this card and you will not regret it. Worth the little higher price
customer_reviews.text: Card works exactly as expected in my LG G3 phone. Fast writing speeds, no compatibility issues, and the included USB card reader is simply icing on the cake. card is well built and not flimsy as some of the competitors cards. A little more expense is worth the price.Highly recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Inder Pahwa

customer_reviews.title: Crapped out after 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these in July 2015 for my Surface Pro 3. It worked fine until today when it crapped out. It went into it's safe place of permanently "Write Protected" (they are designed to do this when there is an unrecoverable issue). I wrote to Lexar and I'm awaiting a response. I also found it super amusing that I could not format a Lexar card with their own software (Image rescue) without paying for the product. In hindsight I should have gone with a SanDisk.
customer_reviews.author: R. Amiss

customer_reviews.title: Good Card, Fast Transfer Rate.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! I bought it to use my Nokia 1520 as a video recorder during a vacation trip. This card worked great. If your video stutter (depending on media settings and gadget) steam video to device first and copy all to card after. I used it with 1080 video /24f and 30/f. I also briefly used it for taking 4K.
customer_reviews.author: Almitani

customer_reviews.title: was fine until it wasn't
customer_reviews.text: Writing this review 9 months after purchase. This card worked fine until it didn't. It has failed (read only mode, unable to repartition in any OS with any tool). It's apparently under warranty and I will try returning it but less than a year of service for this expensive top speed card was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: David K.

customer_reviews.title: Works fine now but was a terror to use out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a bit iffy with this one for now. I bought this card to use with my Gopro Hero 4, which is listed as one of the recommended cards on the gopro website. When I went to use the card I was getting an SD card error and the recording would get corrupted. What I then had to do was format the card inside the gopro, while that was plugged into the computer. The card is currently working in the gopro without the write error (for now). I am not sure if this is the standard with all Lexar cards, but I never had this issue with any other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bowen

product_meta.title: Lexar High-Performance MicroSDXC 633x 64GB UHS-I U1 w/USB 3.0 Reader Flash Memory Card (old U3 version) LSDMI64GBBNL633R
feature_bullets: Premium memory solution for sports camcorders, tablets, and smartphones
Quickly captures, stores, plays back, and transfers media files, including 1080p fullHD, 3D, and 4K video | Leverages UHSI technology for a transfer speed up to 633x (95MB/s)
Performance of U1 and U3 version is exactly the same
Includes highspeed, Class 10 card and USB 3.0 reader
Recommended by GoPro for use with Hero3 and Hero3+

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,710 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
